description.p: Rounds off a number to a specified number of decimal places.

prototypes.prototype: Round as N (Number as N, DecimalPlaces as N)

description.p: The number of decimal places to round to. A value greater than or equal to zero.
Returns the value rounded to the nearest decimal place.

discussion.p: The Round function rounds off a number to a specified number of decimal places. See also [NativeRound] and [Truncate].

example.caption: Round() function executed on the Northwind Access database

page.example: SELECT FIRST 1 Round(12.3) AS EXPR1, ROUND(-4.6) AS EXPR2 FROM Products = 12|-5
